results.title: Playing with fire
results.creator_credit: Frank Cantor, Christopher Knight and National Fire Protection Association. Public Affairs Division
results.brief_description: Two children take some matches from home and set fire to a truck, which in the process of exploding burns them both badly. A doctor explains that dangers should be explained to children as so often in the domestic situation children are put at risk when with care and commonsense these can be avoided.

results.title: Planning for survival: world conservation strategy
results.brief_description: In 1980, a document on the World Conservation Strategy was published which identified goals to be implemented if the world was to survive. This video presentation outlines each goal and suggests solutions. Presents teachers with a good biological model. No other credits available.

results.title: Planet ocean
results.brief_description: Tamara Rewse, a self confessed avid stamp collector explores the unknown depths of the ocean, coming across creatures such as sharks, dolphins and manta rays, which co-incidentally can also be found in Australia Post’s Planet Ocean series of stamps. Includes discussion with the stamp’s designer.

results.title: Place in the sun
results.creator_credit: William Morrison, Stanley H. Bloom and University of Southern California. Dept. of Cinema
results.brief_description: Confident student docu-drama is a polemical work outlining the benefits of more liberal work farms over traditional prisons. Initial fictional sequence is a brooding and highly stylised play of light and shadow, the mood heightened further by Hoyt S. Curtin’s dramatic score. Revolves around the experiences of a young boy is caught by sheriff officers during an attempted burglury. Sentenced to a labour farm, he finds confident and sympathetic supervision and constructive activity that enables him to regain his self respect. In this ‘place in the sun’ there are no walls or any of the oppressiveness of prison atmosphere. The boy finds, instead, hard work, an opportunity to acquire useful skills, and the knowledge that he can become a useful member of society.

results.title: Pintubi
results.brief_description: The Pintubi tribe of the Northern Territory still live nomadically by hunting and gathering, and have little contact with white Australians. The film shows how the Administration is attempting to help them. Music composed and played by Don Burrows, narration by James Dibble.

results.title: Pink triangles
results.brief_description: Examines discrimination against lesbians and gay men, challenging some of society’s attitudes towards homosexuality in the process. Also looks at historical patterns of racial, religious, political and sexual persecution. Historical photographs, prints, engravings and archival film, including footage from Nazi Germany and the 1954 McCarthy trials, have been incorporated in this powerful documentary. During the middle ages pink triangles represented ‘victim’ resurfacing in Nazi Germany concentration camps to identify homosexuals before being reclaimed by gay activists towards the end of the 20th century as a positive symbol to represent their struggle.

results.title: Pilferage
results.brief_description: The problem of shoplifting in self-service stores. A grocer is seen trying various solutions. Points out that many legal technicalities are involved in direct accusation; that some means of dissuading shoplifters will also irritate good ccustomers; but continuous courtesy and helpfulness will drive away the bad customers while retaining the good.

results.title: Pigeon that came home: a story of the Fjord country
results.brief_description: The life of Norwegian farm boys living by a fjord, enjoying swimming, fishing, boating and farming. They care for a pigeon “Lucky” and train her to carry messages. She plays her part in the exciting rescue when one of the boys has an accident. An introduction to Norway - its geography, people and customs.

results.title: Pierre Guimond: betwixt Freud and Dracula
results.creator_credit: Michel Poulette, Monique Turcotte and Nuit Blanche
results.brief_description: Shows the photo montage work of Pierre Guimond who creates disturbing images using cutouts from magazines. The visual images and sounds are well matched to involve and sometimes shock the viewer. This film is suitable for upper secondary school level.

results.title: Picture Canada = Images du Canada
results.creator_credit: Bruno Rubeo, All About Us, GBR and Nous Auties
results.brief_description: Animated film showing a child’s view of the Canadian landscape through children’s paintings. There is no dialogue, only background music and sound effects.
